main event: On September 19, 1954, there was a reported sighting of a round, star-like object with a halo exhibiting random motion for approximately 3 minutes near Montgomery, Alabama. The object was described as moving in a random motion and was likely balloons released on the same date.
interesting points: The sighting involved a round, star-like object with a halo and random motion for 3 minutes.
The military report described four circular lighted objects with a whitish-yellow glow, moving in formation and led by the largest object at high speed and altitude.
The report mentioned the observation of a unidentified flying object approximately 250 feet or less over Montgomery, Alabama.
There was a mention of an official film record and the property of the U.S. Air Force, with reference to cloud cover and apparent brightness scattered, as well as thunderstorms in the area.
The UFO report included a specific date, time, and duration of the sighting, as well as the location of the observer, which was at home near Montgomery, Alabama.
result: Probable balloons released on the same date
witnesses: E. Attie, S. Colvin, 4. Hydie, local resident
